head.title: J. C. Penney Opens At Bronx Mall Site

hedline.hl1: J. C. Penney Opens At Bronx Mall Site

abstract.p: New York City and state officials attend opening of J C Penney store in Co-op City area of Bronx; store will anchor planned enclosed mall--borough's first (S)

block.p: The Bronx may be on the verge of a retail mini-renaissance. New York City and state officials gathered this week for the opening of a new J. C. Penney store, which will anchor a planned enclosed mall -- the borough's first.

Prestige Properties and Development Company and the Shopco Group, both of Manhattan, said they will jointly develop the Mall at Bay Plaza on a 21-acre site in the Co-op City area, just north of the intersection of the Hutchinson River Parkway and the New England Thruway.

The Bronx may be on the verge of a retail mini-renaissance. New York City and state officials gathered this week for the opening of a new J. C. Penney store, which will anchor a planned enclosed mall -- the borough's first.

Prestige Properties and Development Company and the Shopco Group, both of Manhattan, said they will jointly develop the Mall at Bay Plaza on a 21-acre site in the Co-op City area, just north of the intersection of the Hutchinson River Parkway and the New England Thruway.
The $100 million project, to include two other department stores, restaurants and 100 smaller shops, is scheduled to open in mid-1999.
Prestige developed the Bay Plaza shopping center, adjacent to the mall site, and the success of its stores, including Kmart and Nobody Beats the Wiz, spurred plans for the mall.

The new J. C. Penney, at 100 Baychester Avenue, is the first full-service department store to open in the Bronx in years. It will cater to a largely untapped market of potential shoppers; there are 37,000 residents in nearby Co-op City alone.
